entries.cant_work: When you aren't so busy, you might check with me for a job.
entries.next: I've received no more reports of exotic wildlife that requires control, so I'm returning to my research. Thanks for your help.
entries.notyet: I think I'd like to be alone with my thoughts for a while.
entries.npc_1_1: Hello. I am a zoologist studying the local wildlife -- and, unfortunately, some nonlocal wildlife. A misguided researcher imported Corellian gubburs to Rori for study. They got loose and are now breeding. Will you help me control the population by disposing of one?
entries.npc_1_2: Welcome back! I have another report of a non-native animal endangering the Rori ecosystem. It's a Talusian guf drolg, quite harmful to the ecology.  I'm hoping you can go take care of it for me.
entries.npc_2_1: I appreciate your help -- and I'll make it worth your while when you return here afterward.
entries.npc_2_2: Good. The guf drolg is eating so many other creatures, it's disrupting the local ecosystem. The faster you work, the better.
entries.npc_3_1: Very well, sorry to bother you.
entries.npc_3_2: I'm sorry. That creature is doing substantial damage to the local ecosystem.
entries.npc_4_1: It's an amphibious reptilian, squat and lazy. They capture small insects with a long tongue. They hop, which makes them difficult to target.
entries.npc_4_2: A guf drolg is a large amphibious sauroid native to Talus. It is omnivorous, ill-tempered, and generally hostile. You may need help killing the specimen.
entries.npc_5_1: Gubburs have three long whiskers they use to identify changes in weather and tectonic motion. The researcher apparently wanted to see if these creatures could predict earthquakes here. I never heard the results of the research.
entries.npc_6_1: Gubburs are notorious for their terrible smell. They smell like burning leather, which repels most native predators. One more good reason to destroy them on Rori. Will you help?
entries.npc_backtowork_1: I don't know what else to tell you. Please find a gubbur, preferably of breeding age, and kill it.
entries.npc_backtowork_2: I don't know what else to tell you. I'd help you destroy the guf drolg, but unfortunately I'm currently occupied with my work.
entries.npc_failure_1: You didn't destroy that Corellian gubbur? I wouldn't have thought that a steep challenge.
entries.npc_failure_2: Did you not destroy that guf drolg? Well, I can hardly blame you -- they're fierce.
entries.npc_noloc_1: Excuse me, I have to take a call from my research group leader. Please talk to me again in a moment.
entries.npc_noloc_2: Excuse me, I have to take an important call from my research project director. Talk to me again shortly, please.
entries.npc_reset_1: I understand. Tromping around the wilderness to stomp a gubbur is not my idea of a fun time either.
entries.npc_reward_1: Thank you for your help in controlling the gubbur threat to Rori's sensitive ecosystem. There is more work of this kind, unfortunately, so talk to me again soon.
entries.npc_reward_2: Thank you for disposing of that guf drolg. Thank goodness there was only one of them.
entries.npc_work_1: I hope that Corellian gubbur isn't too much of a challenge for you.
entries.npc_work_2: I hope you're preparing to destroy that Talusian guf drolg. You may need a bit of help, but I'm afraid I'm currently occupied.
entries.player_4_1: Why did the researcher import Corellian gubburs to Rori?
entries.player_5_1: Why don't local predators eat the gubburs?
entries.player_reset_1: I don't want this mission right now.
entries.player_sorry_1: I'll keep working on the mission.
entries.return_waypoint_description_1: This Mon Calamari zoologist will reward you for destroying a non-native Corellian gubbur.
entries.return_waypoint_description_2: This Mon Calamari zoologist will reward you for having destroyed the Talusian guf drolg.
entries.waypoint_description_1: Zoologist Magur Torigai would like this non-native amphibian destroyed before it damages the Rori ecosystem.
entries.waypoint_description_2: Zoologist Magur Torigai would like this Talusian creature destroyed before it damages the Rori ecosystem.
entries.npc_reset_2: I understand. Maybe you'll change your mind later.
entries.player_reset_2: I don't want this mission right now.
entries.player_sorry_2: I'll keep working on the mission.
